About.paragraph:
System for Prediction and Early Detection of Insider Attacks (SPEDIA), financed by the National Cybersecurity Institute of Spain (INCIBE) through its program for promoting Strategic Cybersecurity Projects in Spain, framed within the Recovery, Transformation and Resilience Plan, through funds from the Next Generation EU program. 

 The main objective of SPEDIA is the development of an integrated cybersecurity framework equipped with technical capabilities to confront insider threats that include early detection, identification of anomalous behavior, the parameterization of threats and the Dynamic evaluation of cyber-situational risk.
Why:
The RSTI research group is part of the Department of Telematics Systems Engineering (DIT) in the School of Telecommunication Engineering (ETSIT) of Universidad Politécnica de Madrid (UPM). He is also a member of the Information Processing and Telecommunication Research Center (IPTC).

The group is currently formed by 12 full-time people, including professors, researchers, and administration staff. It has a long experience of participation in European and Spanish R&D projects, collaborations with public bodies and private entities, as well as in the organization and teaching of postgraduate courses.

 The research lines of the RSTI group have been evolving since its creation more than 30 years ago. Currently, the activity carried out in the framework of R&D projects is centered around three main areas.
researchLines: Internet of Things: Sensor networks. Rapid prototyping with Arduino, Raspberry Pi, etc. IoT communications (WiFi, ZigBee, BLE, NFC, LTE, M2M, …). Protocols (MQTT, CoAP). Application to Smart Cities, Retail, Mobility & Transport, Public Safety, …,Data Analytics and Visualization. Remote configuration and management. Web based dashboards.

Advanced Wireless Communications Technologies (5G/6G): Core Network deployments. Evaluation of Network Elements performance. Data and Signalling Traffic Generator. Programable Data Planes, DPDK, P4, Protocol Independent Switching Architecture (PISA). Multi-access Edge Computing (MEC).

Cybersecurity: Dynamic risk management. Cybersecurity Awareness. Application of Artificial Intelligence to Cybersecurity (Machine Learning and Ontologies-based Expert Systems)- Detection and response to intrusions. Simulation and training. Visualization and tracing of cyberattacks. Protection of critical infrastructures.

News.title: SPEDIA at UPM International Summer School – Data & Security
News.description:
From June 30th to July 4th, the SPEDIA team took part in the UPM International Summer School on Data & Security at the Universidad Politécnica de Madrid. The program focused on two key areas: data analysis techniques—such as mining, curation, visualization, and predictive modeling—and cybersecurity challenges, including the protection of digital assets and proactive risk management. 

Our researchers presented SPEDIA’s approach to user modeling and anomaly detection, highlighting how the system anticipates risks and strengthens security. The session fostered constructive discussion with students and academics, contributing to knowledge exchange in data science and cybersecurity.

News.title: SPEDIA at MorterueloCON
News.description:
From February 20th to 22nd, our researchers David and Luis attended the MorterueloCON conference, an important event in the field of cybersecurity and technology. During the event, they had the opportunity to present a talk on the SPEDIA project, showcasing the latest developments and objectives of the initiative.

Their presentation focused on key aspects of the project, including user modeling and risk management within the system. They explained how SPEDIA leverages advanced techniques to understand user behavior and proactively address potential security threats. The session was well-received and contributed to the exchange of ideas and collaboration with other experts in the field.

News.title: SPEDIA with Aalto University
News.description:
Our researcher Alberto had the opportunity to give a talk at an event organized by the team at Aalto University in Finland. During his presentation, he introduced the SPEDIA system, focusing in particular on how user modeling is performed, how anomalous session predictions are carried out, and which models are used in the process.

The session allowed for a detailed discussion of SPEDIA’s technical approach, with the goal of sharing our methodology and receiving valuable feedback from the academic and research community in the field of cybersecurity.

News.title: SPEDIA at RECSI
News.description:
This last week, starting on the 23rd of October, our research group attended the XVIII edition of the RECSI (Reunión Española de Criptología y Seguridad de la Información), organized by the University of León. 

On Friday 25th, our representative, Luis Pérez Miguel, presented our 'Proposal of an Ontology for Insider Risk Management and Treatment'. A proposed ontological framework that implements the ITSRM methodology proposed by ENISA as a flexible knowledge base that allows the inference and evaluation of possible risks in reaction to the events captured by the suspected insider users. Developed under the SPEDIA project, financed by the National Cybersecurity Institute of Spain (INCIBE). 

Throughout the conference, our team had the opportunity to engage with all the teams leading the Spanish research on information security. Showing impactful work on recent interest areas as the development of post-quantum cryptography protocols and tools, and the applications of AI on cybersecurity. We would like to thank all the representatives of the University of Leon for hosting the event and filling out the program with high level technical lectures.

News.title: SPEDIA at ENISE
News.description: The group participated in the 18th edition of the Encuentro Internacional de Seguridad de la Información (ENISE) - 'DesafIA la nueva era digital', which took place in the city of León on October 21, 22 and 23, 2024 at the Palacio de Exposiciones de León. Specifically, the objectives and general lines of the SPEDIA project were presented within the RENIC workshop - Create to transfer (II Edition). With the aim of presenting our proposal in the fight against insider attackers and collecting feedback and general ideas from the scientific community in the area of security.

News.title: SPEDIA at C1b3rWall Congress 2024
News.description:
On June 19th, our colleague Oscar Jover Walsh had the honor of participating as a speaker at the prestigious C1b3rWall Congress on Digital Security and Cyberintelligence, held at the National Police School in Avila. This event, which has now reached its fourth edition, has established itself as a benchmark in the field of cybersecurity, bringing together experts and professionals from the sector to present technological advances and registering more than 16.000 attendees.

 In this edition, focused on the topic of Secure Intelligence, Oscar presented a paper entitled “SPEDIA: System for Prediction and Early Detection of Insider Attacks”. The objective of his presentation was to show the advances that the development team has achieved in the field of insider attack detection. In addition, he showed the work done in the characterization of groups of individuals to identify anomalous behavior, as well as the parameterization of threats, identifying techniques, tactics and procedures used in insider attacks. During his presentation, Oscar also shared case studies and practical examples that illustrate how the SPEDIA system works.

 We would like to express our sincere thanks to the National Police and the sponsors of the C1b3rWall conference for giving us the opportunity to participate in this event. We also thank the National Institute of Cybersecurity (INCIBE) for the opportunity to work and develop cutting-edge systems and projects in the field of cybersecurity.

News.title: SPEDIA at Fundación Circulo de Tecnologías para la Defensa y la Seguridad
News.description:
On May 21, the event organized by the Circulo de Defense and Security Technologies attended by more than 200 people participated in the conference, including members of the Ministry of Interior, the Ministry of Defense, state forces such as the National Police and the Civil Guard, as well as managers of leading companies in cybersecurity and artificial intelligence, such as Microsoft, Airbus, and Navantia, among others.

 At the event, Professor Xavier Larriva Novo gave a presentation on the impact of artificial intelligence and the importance of cybersecurity in research areas referring to the project SPEDIA.

News.title: SPEDIA at Forum InCyber Europe
News.description:
From March 26th to 28th, our project leader Xavier Larriva Novo proudly represented the Spanish delegation from INCIBE - Instituto Nacional de Ciberseguridad at the Forum InCyber Europe (FIC) in Lille, France. As exhibitors, we showcased our System for Prediction and Early Detection of Insider Attacks (SPEDIA). This event provided a valuable platform for us to present our cutting-edge system to a diverse audience of cybersecurity professionals and experts.

 We would like to express our sincere thanks to the organizers and sponsors of the Forum InCyber Europe for giving us the opportunity to participate in this event. We also thank the National Institute of Cybersecurity (INCIBE) for the opportunity to work and develop innovative systems and projects in the field of cybersecurity.

Features.paragraph:
System for Prediction and Early Detection of Insider Attacks (SPEDIA), financed by the National Cybersecurity Institute of Spain (INCIBE) through its program for promoting Strategic Cybersecurity Projects in Spain, framed within the Recovery, Transformation and Resilience Plan, through funds from the Next Generation EU program. 

 The main objective of SPEDIA is the development of an integrated cybersecurity framework equipped with technical capabilities to confront insider threats that include early detection, identification of anomalous behavior, the parameterization of threats and the Dynamic evaluation of cyber-situational risk.

list.title: Detecting Potential Insider Threats
list.text: We specialize in identifying possible cybersecurity incidents related to insider threats, ensuring that any suspicious activity is promptly recognized.

list.title: Characterizing and Identifying Anomalous Behavior
list.text: Our expertise allows us to characterize groups of individuals and detect abnormal behavior among potential insiders within the organization.

list.title: Parametrizing Threats
list.text: We provide detailed parameters for threats, enabling system operators to accurately identify actions performed by insider attackers.

list.title: Suggesting Countermeasures
list.text: We offer tailored countermeasures to address and mitigate internal security incidents effectively.
